Yanoar Pribadi Sarwono, Ph.D.

Email:

Scopus Orcid
Keywords
    Schrödinger Equation Helium-like Atoms Hidrogen Molecule Electron Correlations
Available Topics
  • Solution of Schrödinger equation for atoms and molecules.
  • Electronic structure calculations.
  • Iterative diagonalization techniques for sparse matrices.
  • Electron tunneling lifetime calculations.
Education
  • S.Si. -- Department of Physics, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Indonesia.
  • M.S. -- Department of Physics, College of William and Mary, VA, USA.
  • Ph.D. -- Department of Physics, City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong SAR, China.
Experiences
  • 2022-Now, Researcher, BRIN Research Center for Quantum Physics, Indonesia.
  • 2021-2023, Postdoctoral Researcher, Shenzhen JL Computational Science and Applied Research Institute, Shenzhen, China.
  • 2020, Research Staff, Department of Physics, City University of Hong Kong
  • 2016–2017, Visiting Scholar at Beijing Computational Science Research Center, Beijing, China.
  • 2007-2016, Physics Teacher, PENABUR Secondary Kelapa Gading, Jakarta, Indonesia
Grants/Awards
  • 2018-2019, Outstanding Teaching Awards, City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong SAR, China.
  • 2018-2020, Outstanding Academic Performance Award, City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong SAR, China.
  • 2018–2020, Research Tuition Scholarship, City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong SAR, China.
  • 2017, Beijing Tianhe2-JK 500,000 Computing Hour Allocation, Beijing, China
Selected Publications
  • F. U. Rahman, Y. P. Sarwono, and R. Zhang, "Solution of two-electron Schrödinger equations using a residual minimization method and one-dimensional basis functions", AIP Adv. 11, 025228, 2021.
  • Y. P. Sarwono, F. U. Rahman, and R. Zhang, "Numerical variational solution of hydrogen molecule and ions using one-dimensional hydrogen as basis functions", New J. Phys. 22, 093059, 2020.
  • F. U. Rahman, R. Zhao, Y. P. Sarwono, and R. Zhang, "A scheme of numerical solution for three-dimensional isoelectronic series of hydrogen atom using one-dimensional basis functions", Int. J. Quantum Chem. 118, e25694, 2018.
  • H. Tao, R. Zhao, Y. P. Sarwono, and R. Zhang, "Improved projected Green's function approach to electron tunneling lifetime calculations in quantum wells", Phys. Rev. B 96, 235428, 2017.
  • R. Zhao, Y. P. Sarwono, and R. Zhang, "Tunneling lifetimes of electrons escaping from atoms under a static electric field", J. Chem. Phys. 147, 064109, 2017.
